content:
The provided chunk defines configuration settings related to the handling of egg files. Specifically, it includes definitions for object types such as triggers, spheres, and tubes within egg syntax, along with parameters that control numeric precision in egg file generation. These settings are relevant for configuring how egg files are parsed or generated by the system.

hardcoded Defines egg syntax for the named object type. egg-object-type-trigger string <Collide> { Polyset descend intangible } (from Confauto.prc);
hardcoded Defines egg syntax for the named object type. egg-object-type-trigger-sphere string <Collide> { Sphere descend intangible } (from Confauto.prc);
hardcoded Defines egg syntax for the named object type. egg-object-type-tube string <Collide> { Tube descend } (from Confauto.prc); hardcoded Defines egg syntax for the named object type. egg-precision int 15 The number of digits of precision to write out for values in an egg
file. Leave this at 0 to use the default setting for the stream. egg-preload-simple-textures bool 1 This specifies whether the egg loader will generate simple texture
images for each texture loaded. This supercedes the
preload-simple-textures global default, for egg files. In fact, the egg
loader will generate simple texture images if either this or
